column2: SOUTH DAKOTA DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column4: South Dakota

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column8: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp curve ahead

column2: 3. No Zones are areas around trucks where cars:
column4: can turn safely because several car lengths have been left between the truck and car.
column6: disappear into blind spots or are so close to the truck that the driver's ability to stop or maneuver safely is restricted.
column8: can travel behind trucks at constant speed and have no risks of being involved in a collision.

column2: 4. ABS is the acronym for:
column4: Anti-Braking System

column2: 5. To be able to turn quickly, your hands should be:
column4: on the steering wheel, so they are at the 6 and 12 o'clock positions.
column6: placed outside of the steering wheel on opposite sides
column8: next to each other on the top of the steering wheel.

column2: 6. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: School crossing

column2: 8. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
9. When you are angry or upset you should:
column4: take a few minutes to cool off before you drive.
column6: listen to loud music while driving.
column8: drive fast to let off steam.

column2: 10. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Drive with caution.
column6: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column8: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 11. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 12. When following another vehicle at night, drivers should use:
column4: high beam headlights.

column2: 13. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: blue; white

column2: 14. The basic color for traffic control devices used in construction zones is:
column4: yellow.

column2: 15. Which of the following road surfaces freezes first when wet?
column4: Tunnels.

column2: 16. Yellow traffic signs:
column4: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 17. Bicyclists must:
column4: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column6: remain near the left edge of the road.
column8: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.

column2: 18. If it safe to do so, you can pass a vehicle ahead when:
column4: you are on a hill or curve.
column6: there is a solid line on your side of the road.
column8: there is a broken line on your side of the road.

column2: 19. This sign means:
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 20. When the road is slippery you should:
column4: check your brakes.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Merging Traffic

column2: 22. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column8: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Hill

column2: 24. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.
column6: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
column8: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.

column2: 25. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
